standard_metadata.standard_description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems by graphing points in all four quadrants of the coordinate plane. Include use of coordinates and absolute value to find distances between points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Coordinate plane problems in all four quadrants

question.content: Regina graphs the relationship between temperature (in $\degree\text{C}$) and elevation (in $\text{m}$) of $9$ different cities on the coordinate plane below.     **What is the meaning of point $A$?**

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. The x axis represents the elevation, in meters, and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. A solid point labeled A is plotted at (negative 6, 5). Other solid points are plotted at (negative 7, negative 7), (negative 5, negative 6), (negative 1, 3), (2, 9), (3, 4), (5, negative 8), (7, 6), and (8, 8).

options.content: A city $6 \text{ m}$ *below* sea level is $5 ^{\circ}\text{C}$ *below* zero.
A city $6 \text{ m}$ *above* sea level is $5 ^{\circ}\text{C}$ *below* zero.
A city $6 \text{ m}$ *below* sea level is $5 ^{\circ}\text{C}$ *above* zero.
A city $6 \text{ m}$ *above* sea level is $5 ^{\circ}\text{C}$ *above* zero.

hints.content: Let's find the coordinates of Point $A$, then find the meaning of the coordinates.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. The x axis represents the elevation, in meters, and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. A highlighted solid point labeled A is plotted at (negative 6, 5). Other faded solid points are plotted at (negative 7, negative 7), (negative 5, negative 6), (negative 1, 3), (2, 9), (3, 4), (5, negative 8), (7, 6), and (8, 8).

hints.content: Point $A$ is located $6$ places to the *left* of $0$ on the $x$-axis.   [[☃ image 2]]  $(\goldE{-6}, ?~)$  So Point $A$ represents a city $6$ meters *below* sea level.

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. The x axis represents the elevation, in meters, and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. A highlighted solid point labeled A is plotted at (negative 6, 5). Other faded solid points are plotted at (negative 7, negative 7), (negative 5, negative 6), (negative 1, 3), (2, 9), (3, 4), (5, negative 8), (7, 6), and (8, 8). An arrow moves 6 ticks to the left from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis.

hints.content: Point $A$ is located $5$ places *above* $0$ on the $y$-axis.   [[☃ image 1]]  $(\goldE{-6}, \maroonE{5})$  So, Point A represents a city $5\degree\text{C}$ *above* zero.

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. The x axis represents the elevation, in meters, and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. A highlighted solid point labeled A is plotted at (negative 6, 5). Other faded solid points are plotted at (negative 7, negative 7), (negative 5, negative 6), (negative 1, 3), (2, 9), (3, 4), (5, negative 8), (7, 6), and (8, 8). An arrow moves 6 ticks to the left from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis. An arrow moves up from the sixth tick mark on the x axis out to a point aligned with the number 5 on the y axis.

hints.content: Point $A$ tells us the city $6 \text{ m}$ *below* sea level is $5{\degree}\text{C}$ *above* zero.

question.content: Patrick graphs the relationship between the high temperatures (in $\degree\text{C}$) that he experienced on each day of his trip to Homer, Alaska on the coordinate plane below.     **What is the meaning of point $A$?**

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from 0 to 10 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. A solid point labeled A is plotted at (4 ,7). Other solid points are plotted at (1, negative 4), (2, negative 4), (5, 0), (6, 9), (7, negative 2).

options.content: The high temperature on the $4^\text{th}$ day was $7^{\circ}\text{C}$ *below* zero.
The high temperature on the $4^\text{th}$ day was $7^{\circ}\text{C}$ *above* zero.
The high temperature on the $7^\text{th}$ day was $4^{\circ}\text{C}$ *below* zero.
The high temperature on the $7^\text{th}$ day was $4^{\circ}\text{C}$ *above* zero.

hints.content: Let's find the coordinates of Point $A$, then find the meaning of the coordinates.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from 0 to 10 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. A highlighted solid point labeled A is plotted at (4 ,7). Other faded solid points are plotted at (1, negative 4), (2, negative 4), (5, 0), (6, 9), (7, negative 2).

hints.content: Point $A$ is located $4$ places to the *right* of $0$ on the $x$-axis.   [[☃ image 1]]  $(\goldE{4}, ?~)$  So Point $A$ represents day $4$ of Patrick's trip.

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from 0 to 10 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. A highlighted solid point labeled A is plotted at (4 ,7). Other faded solid points are plotted at (1, negative 4), (2, negative 4), (5, 0), (6, 9), (7, negative 2). An arrow moves 4 ticks to the right from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis.

hints.content: Point $A$ is located $7$ places *above* $0$ on the $y$-axis.   [[☃ image 3]]  $(\goldE{4}, \maroonE{7})$  So, Point $A$ represents a temperature $7\degree\text{C}$ *above* zero.

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from 0 to 10 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. A highlighted solid point labeled A is plotted at (4 ,7). Other faded solid points are plotted at (1, negative 4), (2, negative 4), (5, 0), (6, 9), (7, negative 2). An arrow moves 4 ticks to the right from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis. An arrow moves up from the fourth tick mark on the x axis out to a point aligned with the number 7 on the y axis.

hints.content: Point $A$ tells us the high temperature on the $4^\text{th}$ day was $7\degree\text{C}$ *above* zero.

question.content: Mikoto graphs the relationship between temperature (in $\degree\text{C}$) and her cat's change in weight $($in $\text{g})$ over the last $10$ days on the coordinate plane below.     **What is the meaning of point $A$?**

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. The x axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius, and the y axis represents the weight, in grams. A solid point labeled A is plotted at (negative 9, negative 2). Other solid points are plotted at (negative 8, negative 6), (negative 6, negative 3), (negative 5, 2), (1, 3), (3, 4), (4, 3), (5, 2), (8, 5), and (9, 6).

options.content: On a day $9^{\circ}\text{C}$ *below* zero, Mikoto's cat *lost* $2 \text{ g}$.
On a day $9^{\circ}\text{C}$ *above* zero, Mikoto's cat *lost* $2 \text{ g}$.
On a day $9^{\circ}\text{C}$ *below* zero, Mikoto's cat *gained* $2 \text{ g}$.
On a day $9^{\circ}\text{C}$ *above* zero, Mikoto's cat *gained* $2 \text{ g}$.

hints.content: Let's find the coordinates of Point $A$, then find the meaning of the coordinates.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. The x axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius, and the y axis represents the weight, in grams. A highlighted solid point labeled A is plotted at (negative 9, negative 2). Other faded solid points are plotted at (negative 8, negative 6), (negative 6, negative 3), (negative 5, 2), (1, 3), (3, 4), (4, 3), (5, 2), (8, 5), and (9, 6).

hints.content: Point $A$ is located $9$ places to the *left* of $0$ on the $x$-axis.   [[☃ image 1]]  $(\goldE{-9}, ?~)$  So Point $A$ represents a day $9\degree\text{C}$ *below* zero.

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. The x axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius, and the y axis represents the weight, in grams. A highlighted solid point labeled A is plotted at (negative 9, negative 2). Other faded solid points are plotted at (negative 8, negative 6), (negative 6, negative 3), (negative 5, 2), (1, 3), (3, 4), (4, 3), (5, 2), (8, 5), and (9, 6). An arrow moves 9 ticks to the left from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis.

hints.content: Point $A$ is located $2$ places *below* $0$ on the $y$-axis.   [[☃ image 1]]  $(\goldE{-9}, \maroonE{-2})$  So, Point A is located $2\text{ g}$ *below* zero, which means the cat *lost* weight.

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. The x axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius, and the y axis represents the weight, in grams. A highlighted solid point labeled A is plotted at (negative 9, negative 2). Other faded solid points are plotted at (negative 8, negative 6), (negative 6, negative 3), (negative 5, 2), (1, 3), (3, 4), (4, 3), (5, 2), (8, 5), and (9, 6). An arrow moves 9 ticks to the left from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis. An arrow moves down from the ninth tick mark on the x axis out to a point aligned with the number negative 2 on the y axis.

hints.content: Point $A$ tells us on a day $9^{\circ}\text{C}$ *below* zero, Mikoto's cat *lost* $2 \text{ g}$.

question.content: Lo graphs the relationship between temperature (in $\degree\text{C}$) and elevation (in $\text{m}$) in $9$ different cities on the coordinate plane below.     **What is the temperature in the city with an elevation of $-9 \text{ m}$?**      $\degree\text{C}$

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. The x axis represents the elevation, in meters, and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. Solid points are plotted at (negative 9, 7), (negative 7, 5), (negative 6, negative 9), (negative 3, 2), (4, 8), (6, 2), (7, negative 8), (8, 9), (9, negative 3).

hints.content: The $x$-axis represents the elevation in meters, and the $y$-axis represents the temperature in degrees Celsius ($\degree\text{C}$).  We need to find the point that represents the city with an elevation of $-9 \text{ m}$.
We know the elevation is along the $x$-axis, so we need to move $9$ spaces to the *left* of $0$.  [[☃ image 1]]  $(\goldE{-9}, ?~)$

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. The x axis represents the elevation, in meters, and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. Solid points are plotted at (negative 9, 7), (negative 7, 5), (negative 6, negative 9), (negative 3, 2), (4, 8), (6, 2), (7, negative 8), (8, 9), (9, negative 3). An arrow moves 9 ticks to the left from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis.

hints.content: Now, we look at the $y$-axis to find the temperature in that city.  [[☃ image 1]]  $(\goldE{-9}, \maroonE7)$  The temperature in the city is $7\degree\text{C}$.

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. The x axis represents the elevation, in meters, and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. Solid points are plotted at (negative 9, 7), (negative 7, 5), (negative 6, negative 9), (negative 3, 2), (4, 8), (6, 2), (7, negative 8), (8, 9), (9, negative 3). An arrow moves 9 ticks to the left from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis. An arrow moves up from the ninth tick mark on the x axis out to a point aligned with the number 7 on the y axis.

hints.content: The temperature in the city with an elevation of $-9 \text{ m}$ is $7\degree\text{C}$.

question.content: Adem graphs the low temperatures $($in $\degree\text{C})$ that he experienced on each day of his trip to Istanbul, Turkey on the coordinate plane below.    **What was the low temperature on the $6^{\text{th}}$ day of the trip?**      $\degree\text{C}$

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from 0 to 10 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. Solid points are plotted at (1, negative 4), (2, negative 4), (3, 6), (4, 7), (5, 9), (6, 0), and (7, negative 2).

hints.content: The $x$-axis represents the day of the trip, and the $y$-axis represents the temperature in degrees Celsius ($\degree\text{C}$).  We need to find the point that represents the temperature on Day $6$.
We know the day of the trip is along the $x$-axis, so we need to move $6$ spaces to the *right* of $0$.  [[☃ image 1]]  $(\goldE{6}, ?~)$

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from 0 to 10 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. Solid points are plotted at (1, negative 4), (2, negative 4), (3, 6), (4, 7), (5, 9), (6, 0), and (7, negative 2). An arrow moves 6 ticks to the right from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis.

hints.content: Now, we look at the $y$-axis to find the temperature on that day.  [[☃ image 1]]  $(\goldE{6}, \maroonE0)$  The low temperature in Istanbul, Turkey was $0\degree\text{C}$.

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from 0 to 10 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. A highlighted solid point is plotted at (6, 0). Solid points are plotted at (1, negative 4), (2, negative 4), (3, 6), (4, 7), (5, 9), and (7, negative 2). An arrow moves 6 ticks to the right from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis.

hints.content: The low temperature on the $6^{\text{th}}$ day of the trip was $0^{\degree}\text{C}$.

question.content: Jing graphs the amount of time it takes her to get to work in the last two weeks. The $x$-axis of the graph represents the number of days before today. For example, $-1$ would represent yesterday. The $y$-axis represents the commute time in minutes.    **How many days ago did it take Jing $22$ minutes to get to work?**      days ago

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 1 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 1 to 30 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents number of minutes. Solid points are plotted at (negative 9, 18), (negative 8, 24), (negative 7, 22), (negative 6, 21), (negative 5, 23), (negative 4, 20), (negative 3, 25), and (negative 2, 19).

hints.content: The $x$-axis represents the day relative to today, and the $y$-axis represents the minutes it took Jing to get to work each day.  We need to find the point that represents a $22$ minute commute time.
We know the number of minutes is along the $y$-axis, so we need to move $22$ spaces *above* $0$.  [[☃ image 1]]  $(?, \maroonE{22})$

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 1 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 1 to 30 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents number of minutes. Solid points are plotted at (negative 9, 18), (negative 8, 24), (negative 7, 22), (negative 6, 21), (negative 5, 23), (negative 4, 20), (negative 3, 25), and (negative 2, 19). An arrow moves 22 ticks up from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the x axis.

hints.content: Now, we look at the $x$-axis to find how many days ago Jing's commute took $22$ minutes.  [[☃ image 1]]  $(\goldE{-7}, \maroonE{22})$  It happened $7$ days ago.

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 1 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 1 to 30 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents number of minutes. Solid points are plotted at (negative 9, 18), (negative 8, 24), (negative 7, 22), (negative 6, 21), (negative 5, 23), (negative 4, 20), (negative 3, 25), and (negative 2, 19). An arrow moves 22 ticks up from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the x axis. An arrow moves left from the twenty second tick mark on the y axis out to a point aligned with the number negative 7 on the x axis. There is a dashed line that is perpendicular to the x axis that starts on the x axis at negative 7 and goes straight up until it reaches the point (negative 7, 22).

hints.content: It took Jing $22$ minutes to get to work $7$ days ago.

question.content: The temperatures at several times of the day are graphed on the coordinate plane below.   The $x$-axis represents the number of hours before or after midnight.  For example, $-1$ would represent $11 \text{ p.m.}$ The $y$-axis represents the temperature in degrees Celsius.    **At what time was the temperature $7\degree\text{C}$?**      $\text{ a.m.}$

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from 0 to 10 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of hours and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. Solid points are plotted at (0, 6), (1, 4), (2, 7), (3, 8), (4, 4 and 1 half), (5, 5), (6, 1), (7, 2), (8, negative 3), and (9, negative 2).

hints.content: The $x$-axis represents the time of day relative to midnight, and the $y$-axis represents the temperature in $\degree\text{C}$.  We need to find the point that represents $7\degree\text{C}$.
We know the temperature is along the $y$-axis, so we need to move $7$ spaces *above* $0$.  [[☃ image 1]]  $(?, \maroonE{7})$

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from 0 to 10 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of hours and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. Solid points are plotted at (0, 6), (1, 4), (2, 7), (3, 8), (4, 4 and 1 half), (5, 5), (6, 1), (7, 2), (8, negative 3), and (9, negative 2). An arrow moves 7 ticks up from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the x axis.

hints.content: Now, we look at the $x$-axis to find what time it was when it was $7\degree\text{C}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  $(\goldE{2}, \maroonE{7})$  It was $2\text{ a.m.}$.

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from 0 to 10 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of hours and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. Solid points are plotted at (0, 6), (1, 4), (2, 7), (3, 8), (4, 4 and 1 half), (5, 5), (6, 1), (7, 2), (8, negative 3), and (9, negative 2). An arrow moves 7 ticks up from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the x axis. An arrow moves right from the seventh tick mark on the y axis out to a point aligned with the number 2 on the x axis. There is a dashed line that is perpendicular to the x axis that starts on the x axis at 2 and goes straight up until it reaches the point (2, 7).

hints.content: It was $2\text{ a.m.}$ when the temperature was $7\degree\text{C}$.

question.content: The high and low temperatures for $6$ days in Cloud City are plotted on the coordinate plane.  The $x$-axis represents the day number, and the $y$-axis represents the temperature in degrees Celsius ($\degree\text{C}$).      **What was the difference between the high and low temperatures on Day $6$?**

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 2 to 8 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 24 to 24 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. The high temperatures are plotted using solid red points at (1, 24), (2, 21), (3, 15), (4, 18), (5, 6), (6, 9). The low temperatures are plotted using solid blue rectangles at (1, 21), (2, 18), (3, 6), (4, 12), (5, negative 6), (6, 0).
A solid, red point represents the high temperature. A solid, blue rectangle represents the low temperature.

hints.content: We need to find the coordinates of the two points representing the high and low temperatures on day $6$, then find the distance between them.

To identify the temperatures on day $6$, we need to move $6$ spaces to the right of $0$ on the $x$-axis and find the high and low temperatures on the $y$-axis.  [[☃ image 1]]  Day $6$ has a low temperature of $0\degree \text{C}$ and a high temperature of $9\degree \text{C}$.

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 2 to 8 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 24 to 24 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. An arrow moves 6 ticks to the right from the origin on the x axis out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis. An arrow moves up from the sixth tick mark on the x axis to a point aligned with the number 9 on the y axis. A solid point labeled (6, 0) is plotted. A solid point labeled (6, 9) is plotted.

hints.content: Since both points are on the same side of the axis, we can determine their distance from each other using absolute value:  $\begin{align} &\lvert\text{value  farther from axis}\rvert -\lvert\text{value closer from axis}\rvert = \text{distance}\\\\ &\lvert9\lvert - \lvert0\lvert = \text{distance}\\\\ &9 - 0= ~?\\\\ &9 \end{align}$
The difference between the high and low temperatures on Day $6$ was $9\degree\text{C}$.

question.content: Tyrion graphs the relationship between temperature (in $\degree\text{C}$) and his pets' changes in weight $($in $\text{g})$ over the last $8$ days on the coordinate plane below.   The $x$-axis represents the temperature in degrees Celsius ($\degree\text{C}$) and the $y$-axis represents the weight in grams ($\text{g}$).      **What is the difference between the dog and cat's weight when it was $4\degree\text{C}$?**

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 9 to 9 from the origin in both the x and y axis. The x axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius, and the y axis represents the weight, in grams. The dog's change in weight is represented by plotting solid red points at (negative 8, negative 2), (negative 6, 1), (negative 4, 2), (0, 3), (2, 3), (4, 7), (5, 5), (7, 6). The cat's change in weight is represented by plotted solid blue rectangles at (negative 8, negative 3), (negative 6, 0), (negative 4, 1), (0, 0), (2, 2), (4, 3), (5, 1), (7, 4).
A solid, red point represents the dog's change in weight. A solid, green rectangle represents the cat's change in weight.

hints.content: We need to find the coordinates of the two points representing the pets' changes in weight when it was $4\degree\text{C}$, then find the distance between them.

To identify the pets' changes in weight when it was $4\degree\text{C}$, we need to move $4$ spaces to the right of $0$ on the $x$-axis and find the change in weights on the $y$-axis for the dog and cat.  [[☃ image 2]]  When it was $4\degree\text{C}$, Tyrion's cat had a change in weight of $3\text{ g}$ and his dog had a change in weight of $7\text{ g}$.

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 9 to 9 from the origin in both the x and y axis. The x axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius, and the y axis represents the weight, in grams. A solid red point is plotted at (4, 7) and a solid blue rectangle is plotted at (4, 3). An arrow moves 4 ticks to the right from the origin on the x axis out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis. An arrow moves up from the fourth tick mark on the x axis to a point aligned with the number 3 on the y axis. An arrow moves up from the point (4, 3) to a point aligned with the number 7 on the y axis.

hints.content: Since both points are on the same side of the axis, we can determine their distance from each other using absolute value:  $\begin{align} &\lvert\text{value  farther from axis}\rvert -\lvert\text{value closer from axis}\rvert = \text{distance}\\\\ &\lvert7\lvert - \lvert3\lvert = \text{distance}\\\\ &7 - 3= ~?\\\\ &4 \end{align}$
The difference between the dog and cat's changes in weight when the temperature was $4\degree\text{C}$ is $4\text{ g}$.

question.content: The temperatures at several times of the day are graphed on the coordinate plane below.   The $x$-axis represents the number of hours before or after noon.   For example, $-1$ would represent $11 \text{ a.m.}$ The $y$-axis represents the temperature in degrees Celsius.    **What was the difference between the temperatures at $3\text{ p.m.}$ and $7\text{ p.m.}$?**

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from 0 to 10 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of hours and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. Solid points are plotted at (0, 6), (1, 4), (2, 7), (3, 8), (4, 4 and 1 half), (5, 5), (6, 1), (7, 2), (8, negative 3), and (9, negative 2).

hints.content: We need to find the coordinates of the two points representing the  temperatures at $3\text{ p.m.}$ and $7\text{ p.m.}$, then find the distance between them.

To identify the temperature at $3\text{ p.m.}$, we need to move $3$ spaces to the right of $0$ on the $x$-axis and find the temperature on the $y$-axis.  [[☃ image 1]]  The temperature at $3\text{ p.m.}$ was $8\degree\text{C}$.

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from 0 to 10 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of hours and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. A highlighted solid point is plotted at (3, 8). Faded solid points are plotted at (0, 6), (1, 4), (2, 7), (4, 4 and 1 half), (5, 5), (6, 1), (7, 2), (8, negative 3), and (9, negative 2). An arrow moves 3 ticks to the right from the origin on the x axis out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis. An arrow moves up from the third tick mark on the x axis to a point aligned with the number 8 on the y axis.

hints.content: To identify the temperature at $7\text{ p.m.}$, we need to move $7$ spaces to the right of $0$ on the $x$-axis and find the temperature on the $y$-axis.  [[☃ image 1]]  The temperature at $7\text{ p.m.}$ was $2\degree\text{C}$.

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from 0 to 10 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of hours and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. A highlighted solid point is plotted at (7, 2). Faded solid points are plotted at (0, 6), (1, 4), (2, 7), (3, 8), (4, 4 and 1 half), (5, 5), (6, 1), (8, negative 3), and (9, negative 2). An arrow moves 7 ticks to the right from the origin on the x axis out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis. An arrow moves up from the seventh tick mark on the x axis to a point aligned with the number 2 on the y axis.

hints.content: Since both points are on the same side of the axis, we can determine their distance from each other using absolute value:  $\begin{align} &\lvert\text{value  farther from axis}\rvert -\lvert\text{value closer from axis}\rvert = \text{distance}\\\\ &\lvert8\lvert - \lvert2\lvert = \text{distance}\\\\ &8 - 2= ~?\\\\ &6 \end{align}$
The difference between the temperatures at $3\text{ p.m.}$ and $7\text{ p.m.}$ was $6\degree\text{C}$.

question.content: The high and low temperatures for $6$ days in Cloud City are plotted on the coordinate plane.  The $x$-axis represents the day number, and the $y$-axis represents the temperature in degrees Celsius ($\degree\text{C}$).     **On which day was there a low temperature of $18\degree\text{C}$?**

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 2 to 8 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 24 to 24 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. The high temperatures are plotted using solid red points at (1, 24), (2, 21), (3, 15), (4, 18), (5, 6), (6, 9). The low temperatures are plotted using solid blue rectangles at (1, 21), (2, 18), (3, 6), (4, 12), (5, negative 6), (6, 0).

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 2 to 8 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 24 to 24 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. The low temperatures are plotted using solid blue rectangles at (1, 21), (2, 18), (3, 6), (4, 12), (5, negative 6), (6, 0).

hints.content: The $y$ -axis represents temperature. We can move *up* on the $y$-axis to $18$ and see which days are at $18\degree\text{C}$.   [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 2 to 8 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 10 to 24 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. The low temperatures are plotted using solid blue rectangles at (1, 21), (2, 18), (3, 6), (4, 12), (5, negative 6), (6, 0). There is a dashed line that runs parallel to the x axis and passes through 18 on the y axis.

hints.content: Now, we can move down from that point to the $x$-axis to identify which day had this temperature.   [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 2 to 8 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 10 to 24 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. The low temperatures are plotted using solid blue rectangles at (1, 21), (2, 18), (3, 6), (4, 12), (5, negative 6), (6, 0). There is a dashed line that runs parallel to the x axis and passes through 18 on the y axis. There is a dashed line that runs parallel to the y axis and passes through 2 on the x axis.

hints.content: Day $2$ had a low temperature of $18\degree\text{C}$.

question.content: Paulo tracks his commute time. The coordinate plane below shows some of his commute times in the last two weeks. The $x$-axis of the graph represents days.  The $y$-axis represents the commute time in minutes.    **On which day did it take Paulo $23$ minutes to get to work?**

The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents the number of minutes. Solid points are plotted at (1, 20), (2, 19), (3, 25), (4, 20), (5, 23), (6, 21), (7, 22), (8, 24), and (9, 18).

hints.content: The $x$-axis represents days, and the $y$-axis represents the amount of time it took Paulo to get to work each day.  We need to find the point that represents the day it took Paulo $23$ minutes to get to work.
The $y$ -axis represents time in minutes. We can move *up* on the $y$-axis to $23$ and see which days are at $23$ minutes.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from 0 to 10 from the origin in the x axis and from 0 to 30 in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents the number of minutes. Solid points are plotted at (1, 20), (2, 19), (3, 25), (4, 20), (5, 23), (6, 21), (7, 22), (8, 24), and (9, 18). There is a dashed line that runs parallel to the x axis and passes through 23 on the y axis.

hints.content: Now, we can move down from that point to the $x$-axis to identify which day had this commute time.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from 0 to 10 from the origin in the x axis and from 0 to 30 in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents the number of minutes. Solid points are plotted at (1, 20), (2, 19), (3, 25), (4, 20), (5, 23), (6, 21), (7, 22), (8, 24), and (9, 18). There is a dashed line that runs parallel to the x axis and passes through 23 on the y axis. There is a dashed line that runs parallel to the y axis and passes through 5 on the x axis. A solid point labeled (5, 23) is plotted where the dashed lines intersect.

hints.content: Day $5$ had a commute time of $23$ minutes.

question.content: Elea graphs the temperatures $($in $\degree\text{C})$ that she experienced on each day of her trip to Zurich, Switzerland on the coordinate plane below.    **What was the temperature on the $2^{\text{nd}}$ day of the trip?**      $\degree\text{C}$

We know the day of the trip is along the $x$-axis, so we need to move $2$ spaces to the *right* of $0$.  [[☃ image 1]]  $(\goldE{2}, ?~)$

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from 0 to 8 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 11 to 11 in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. Solid points are plotted at (1, negative 3), (2, negative 4), (3, 2), (4, 5), (5, negative 2), (6, 0), and (7, negative 2). hints.content: Now, we look at the $y$-axis to find the temperature on that day.  [[☃ image 1]]  $(\goldE{6}, \maroonE{-4})$  The temperature was $-4\degree\text{C}$.

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from 0 to 8 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 11 to 11 in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents the temperature, in degrees Celsius. An arrow moves down from the second tick mark on the x axis out to a point aligned with the number negative 4 on the y axis.

hints.content: The temperature on the $2^{\text{nd}}$ day of the trip was $-4\degree\text{C}$.

question.content: Mei graphed the locations of several places in her town on the coordinate plane shown below.    **Which location has an $x$-coordinate of $6$?**

A solid point labeled Library is 5 units to the left of and 3 units down from the origin. A solid point labeled Home is at the origin. A solid point labeled Bank is 6 units down from the origin. A solid point labeled Grocery Store is 5 units to the right of and 6 units up from the origin. A solid point labeled Hospital is 6 units to the right of and 8 units down from the origin. A solid point labeled School is 7 units to the right of the origin.

hints.content: An ordered pair $(\maroonD{x}, \tealE{y})$ gives the location of a point on the coordinate plane.  $\maroonD{x}$ describes where the point is along the $\maroonD{\text{horizontal}}$ axis.  $\tealE{y}$ describes where the point is along the $\tealE{\text{vertical}}$ axis.  A point’s distance from the $y$-axis is related to the point’s $x$-coordinate.
In order to find the location with an $x$-coordinate of $6$, we can move *right* on the $x$-axis to $6$ and see which locations are located along this coordinate.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. A solid point labeled Courthouse is 5 units to the left of and 6 units up from the origin. A solid point labeled Library is 5 units to the left of and 3 units down from the origin. A solid point labeled Home is at the origin. A solid point labeled Bank is 6 units down from the origin. A solid point labeled Grocery Store is 5 units to the right of and 6 units up from the origin. A solid point labeled Hospital is 6 units to the right of and 8 units down from the origin. A solid point labeled School is 7 units to the right of the origin. There is a dashed line that runs parallel to the y axis and passes through 6 on the x axis.

hints.content: The Hospital has an $x$-coordinate of $6$.

question.content: Kennan graphed the location of several places in his town on the coordinate plane shown below.    **Determine if each statement about Kennan's graph is true or false.**   Statement | True/False - | - | - The library is $5$ units from the $y$-axis. |  The school is located at $(0,6)$. |

A point’s distance from the $y$-axis is related to the point’s $x$-coordinate.

Art is $\maroonD{14}$ units from the $\maroonD{\text{library}}$ and $\purpleD6$ units from $\purpleD{\text{science}}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  $\purpleD6<\maroonD{14}$, so art is closer to $\purpleD{\text{science}}$, *not*  the $\maroonD{\text{library}}$.

question.content: Aditya installed solar panels for her house. Aditya's graphed the net electricity use in the first week of July. The $x$-axis represents days in July, and the $y$-axis represents net electricity use in kilowatt-hours ($\text{kWh}$).    **Determine if each statement about the graph is true or false.**    Statement | True/False - | - | - The highest net electricity use occurred on July $4^\text{th}$. |  The net electricity use on July $2^\text{nd}$ is represented by $(2,-1)$. |

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 1 to 8 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 5 to 5 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents the net electricity use, in kilowatt hours. Solid points are plotted at (1, 1 and 1 half), (2, 0), (3, 1 and 3 fourths), (4, 3), (5, negative 1), (6, 1 fourth), and (7, 1 and 1 fourth).

hints.content: An ordered pair $(\maroonD{x}, \tealE{y})$ gives the location of a point on the coordinate plane.  $\maroonD{x}$ describes where the point is along the $\maroonD{\text{horizontal}}$ axis.  $\tealE{y}$ describes where the point is along the $\tealE{\text{vertical}}$ axis.  A point’s distance from the $y$-axis is related to the point’s $x$-coordinate.

July $4^\text{th}$ is represented by an $x$-value of $\maroonE4$.  [[☃ image 1]]  The net electricity usage on this day is represented by a $y$-value of $\tealE3$. The point $(\maroonE4,\tealE3)$ has the largest $y$-value out of all points shown.   The highest net electricity use occurred on July $4^\text{th}$.

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 1 to 8 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 5 to 5 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents the net electricity use, in kilowatt hours. A highlighted solid point is plotted at (4, 3). Faded solid points are plotted at (1, 1 and 1 half), (2, 0), (3, 1 and 3 fourths), (5, negative 1), (6, 1 fourth), and (7, 1 and 1 fourth). An arrow moves 4 tick marks to the right from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis. An arrow moves up from the fourth tick mark on the x axis out to a point aligned with the number 3 on the y axis.

hints.content: July $2^\text{nd}$ is represented by an $x$-value of $\maroonE2$.  [[☃ image 1]]  The net electricity usage on this day is represented by a $y$-value of $\tealE0$.   The coordinates of the point are $(2,0)$.

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 1 to 8 from the origin in the x axis and from negative 5 to 5 from the origin in the y axis. The x axis represents the number of days and the y axis represents the net electricity use, in kilowatt hours. A highlighted solid point is plotted at (2, 0). Faded solid points are plotted at (1, 1 and 1 half), (3, 1 and 3 fourths), (4, 3), (5, negative 1), (6, 1 fourth), and (7, 1 and 1 fourth). An arrow moves 2 tick marks to the right from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis.
